snippet: From Mitt Romney’s loss through the recent tax fight, Republicans have seen the foundations of their strategy called into question, stirring a debate about how to reshape the party.
abstract: Increasingly fractured and feuding Republican Party seems unified on fact that it is facing major crossroads; from Mitt Romney's loss on Election Day through most recent tax fight that shattered party discipline, Republicans have seen foundations of their political strategy called into question, stirring newly urgent debate about how to reshape and define their party.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Jim Rutenberg from New York.

lead_paragraph: From Mitt Romney’s loss through the recent tax fight, Republicans have seen the foundations of their strategy called into question, stirring a debate about how to reshape the party.

headline.seo: Big Battles Ahead, Divided G.O.P. Begins Soul-Searching
headline.main: G.O.P. Begins Soul-Searching After Tax Vote
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Begins Soul-Searching After Tax Vote

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
